reviews.text:
This is an amazing tree. 
Love spending time here. 
Up close, it has spooky features and people love photographing it. 
The tree got so large because it was close to the original Lily Pond and it got water from the pond for decades. 
The new Lily Pond is cement, so the tree's drinking days from it are over. 
However, this beautifully, massive wonder will be around for a long time and it is worth the time to see it. 

George Vreeland Hill

It's a pretty epic size tree with all sorts of uncommon growth features as roots dangle down to the ground and others wrap around a large bolder encased in the midsection of the tree.

It's over 100 years old and over 5 stories tall.
Cool figure tree. Preserved too. Located on Beverly Dr. near the drummer sculpture.
Very big
Nice

I went to a exhibit for Black History Month. The staff and exhibit was a great experience. I will be returning more often. Park in the garage near the Center. Many places to eat in the area. Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall are steps away. Public transportation is the best way to go.

It isn't a traditional museum. It's more of a library where you get to view their catalog of video collections. They have a lot of stuff including some really old TV commercials I enjoyed a lot. I also recommended the new video game section they're developing. There you can play some of the latest games (VR!!).

The Paley Center for Media is the quintessential New York City must see! Especially if you're like me and enjoy their on-going interactive Video Game exhibit! Thanks for the great customer service as well!

Great place for meeting celebrities and catching up on interview. They staff is so friendly and nice. They answer inquiries before, during and after shows. Depending on the celebrity you're trying to see it may or may not get crowded. 
Would come back again for a convention. It's great for start up journalists to get interviews from some celebrities.

I have visited this space twice: once for a panel and once for an awards ceremony. The space is versatile and features a variety of rooms. Waitstaff and bars were a feature at the most recent event I attended in this space, and they were able to service the crowd with ease.

I also had the please of sitting in the theatre downstairs. It was spacious and clean. My only complaint was the lack of visible seat numbers, which made finding our reserved seats challenging.

Overall, I would recommend this space for events.
Get your bagel & Lox fix here for brunch! Ask for outdoor seating in the balcony/patio area! Fred's got the best views of the Hollywood Hills!
The food is great! Fantastic View! Would like to have a party there!

I visited the BH location for the first time new years day for my moms birthday brunch and I was rather shocked at the interior condition of the place. It is not nearly as well maintained as the NYC location and there are visible cracks on the walls. I provided the hostess with candles for my moms desert and I would have preferred that they not put in on the desert as supposed to bringing the desert with an unlit candle. The service and food was good and I would most likely return and be seated outside.
At a party poor food
Best view of beverly hills/ next to peninsula - hidden gem and yummy food.
The experience was great! Everyone was so nice and the food was wonderful. Colette was an excellent server. We will definitely be back the next time we are in the area.

Always a go to for a healthy and farm to table breakfast when I’m in town. Great omelets, granola and other typical breakfast items. Haven’t had lunch there yet. Great interior design but I always opp for sitting outside. Easy location and around lots of great high end shopping after including a Starbucks across the street.
Brunch...same waiter we have had on weekends for 8 years...nice guy...great attitude. Great food.  Nice outside sitting area.

Tucked away in a small booth to escape the cold with my two-best friends. Food was savory and the service was thoughful and prompt. Nice place to spend a bit if time in a town that's always moving too fast for me.

Wonderful service, great location in Beverly Hills.   The Farm has more locals than tourists, it's that good.  If you're visiting this is an excellant place for breakfast lunch and brunch.  We live 8 blocks away and we frequently have breakfast, brunch there.

My friend and I gave Kate an A+. Gabrielle greeted us and seated us and Brian took excellent care of myself and my birthday friend Paula.
We liked the people, the service,  and the food so much, we have decided to have our monthly business meetings there. Parking is convenient and reasonable and oh, my gosh, you are in Beverly Hills.
Food is not bad, but too expensive for what it is.  Don't understand why you can't substitute side items.
So sorry it closed loved the thin pancakes for breakfast, Mac and cheese for lunch, and the salad tricolore for my husband.
boy, you are not kidding about attitude!  don't do me any favors! there are plenty of places serving higher quality food who employ staff who can at the very least "act" like they are accomodating.

My favorite Restaurant in Beverly Hills..They have the best service, nice private booth seating area and great selection of Beer. The food is to die 4 i certainly recommend the salmon dish smh wow mouth watering.....

My wife and I just finished the most amazing meal! We decided to celebrate our 21st anniversary here.  Everything that came to the table was delicious. We had a grilled romaine lettuce appetizer that tasted like a steak! We will definitely be back. Our waitress Delia made our dining experience feel nice and slow and was very attentive to our needs.

The service was amazing, drinks and wine selections were perfect, appetizers were solid. Two of our dinners, pasta dishes, were perfect, the veal parm was not good at all. Been to tons of Italian places, worst veal yet. La Scala is an absolute gem in Baltimore's Little Italy. The ambiance is old school romantic Italian - dim lights, exposed brick, dark wood, and white table cloths. But don't let the classic feel fool you. La Scala is anything but stuffy. The menu includes modern twists on Italian classics and the servers are friendly, knowledgeable, and eager to offer their suggestions and answer questions. In addition to their sizable printed menu, there are numerous creative and enticing specials every evening.

So good.  Loved the Risotto. A little fancy for our family but the kids loved the ambiance and service esp.  the huge pepper grinder.  Everyone left well fed and happy.  Great little bocce grotto downstairs.  Wish I knew how to play.

Great food. Wasn't happy that they tried to stick us next to the kitchen but I asked to be moved and they moved me but the seat was in a walk way. The food was good I just thought it was too crowded to enjoy. There are other places just as good that aren't trying to squeeze you into a shoe box.

This food is so good. . . I hate savory grits but these grits are to die for. The potatoes are also to die for. The atmosphere is amazing. I tend to be   picky about food. This Italian restaurant is  worth it 100 times .

The Avalon Hotel is an iconic site and it's restaurant Viviane is a gorgeous backdrop to any breakfast or lunch date. The food also looks amazing, but the taste wasn't there for us. We got a $20 burger and a Chicken Sandwich. The service was also great so no complaints about that. Perhaps going on NYE for lunch is not best to use for a benchmark, will have to try again. I would definitely come here to get drink though, it's a beautiful location.
Food was great, as was the service. Outdoor seating has a "Madmen go to LA" feel. Not my style but good food and service get the vote.
We ate outside on the patio near the pool. Old style hotel with a relaxed atmosphere. I had the cheeseburger and fries for lunch. Would recommend.
Beautiful restaurant inside the Avalon Hotel. Quite lovely. Great service and food.

We had a lovely, very reasonably priced Saturday brunch poolside at the wonderfully-retro Viviane.
Challah french toast and eggs were delicious. If you want a quintessentially Beverly Hills dining experience for not-so-Beverly Hills prices, go here! Street parking is close-by and abundant. Note that Viviane also has an elegant, mid-century bar just off the pool. Staff were charming and efficient.

The Stinking Rose has been in LA longer than I can remember.  I went when I was much younger and then again not too long ago while on vacation in LA.  It was as good as I remember and would love to go again.

Firstly, you can't help but be impressed with the decor.  It's like eating in your own private cabana somewhere in an exotic location.  It's unlike any other interior I've seen.  Then, while you wait for your food, they bring out the most incredible warm garlic rolls which are just heavenly.  So yum.  There's plenty on the menu to choose from, and everything sounds delicious.  I had a beautiful pasta dish, and wasn't disappointed.  The food came out promptly and the staff were friendly and nice.

I DO hate how some restaurants provide valet parking (because there's sometimes just not other choice) and then charge the earth.  But luckily we got a park right outside.

If you're a garlic fan, and love comfort dishes set in a beautiful restaurant with a great ambiance and in a central location in LA, then try the Stinking Rose.  It's well priced and a great experience.

Customer services:5/5
Quality of food: 3/5
Price: 20-50/per

This place is like a theme park! Interior is so cute and fun. Price is good in area and there are vegetarian options as well. But quality of food is depends on what you order. Stake was good but pork-chop was little dry and hard.

Iconic place with fantastic food. A classic Los Angeles staple with a delicious theme 👌👌. It's a beautiful spot with lots of neat decor. Beware, you will leave smelling like Garlic, yes or yes, but it'll be worth it for the delicious experience. Lots of fun and worth the price.

My hubby and I had an excellent time here! I love the little Cabanas they're so private and you feel like you have your own little luxurious restaurant to yourself it's amazing the service is wonderful the food is delicious and the garlic ice cream is a must-try it's interesting and different but if you've never tried it you have to do it just for the experience!

Went for out anniversaries and as being garlic lovers this was definitely a choice for us. Food was great but prices were eve n better. For being in Beverly hills and the amount of talk that goes on with this place it was definitely priced right. We got 2 appetizers, our entree, unlimited bread, pesto and was even able to bring your own bottle of wine - with no cork fee. Total cane out to $99 on the point. Deliciousness and service all in one!

The ambiance is perfect. Lighting is soft, music is non intrusive and service is courteous and informed. The wine glasses are very generous, definitely a plus. However, the food takes itself a bit too seriously! My prawns were over cooked and as a result a bit dry. The fried rice was warm instead of hot so the egg did not blend in. I was slightly disappointed only because of all the hype behind the place. Maybe it was an off day... Nonetheless, highly recommend for a romantic date or a special occasion. The best and most impressive menu item is by far the tuna cigars. Not to be missed. I wish we had had room for dessert.
Amazingly done food. I appreciate their more health-conscious, locally-sourced ingredients. Really, the best and down to earth servers with yummy food!
The newly renovated restaurant is much better. Decor is better. Ambience is great. Traditional items are still available and in addition the new menu items are yummy

The Mongolian lamb practically fell off the bone because it was so tender ( A must try)  The steak was incredible very well seasoned and the garlic noodles is a Oprah favorite and after eating them I understand you won't be disappointed.  The outside patio area has a beautiful wall of flowers that give it a romantic date night feel and the heating lamps will make you forget its winter.
Had Sean as a server and he was amazing! Food was amazing and it was an experience! They knew how to perfectly play with your taste. Beyond amazing

I walked in expecting a table considering I made a Valentine's Day reservation. Lo and behold, I made it for the wrong day. Even after we offered to sit at the bar and have some drinks until a table was ready, they made rearrangements to compensate for my stupidity.  Our server, Bethany, was super attentive, charismatic and sweet. Her suggestions were perfect as well. And oh yeah, the porterhouse for 2 was perfectly tender. And double oh yeah, the mashed potatoes were the fluffiest I've ever had. It was truly the perfect Valentine's Day.

No steak knives required!We were supposed to go to Peter Luger but they "lost" my reservation, very rude! So we found De Stefano's and I'm so glad we did! We had a wonderful time. Straightforward and all-around good. It is located in a quiet neighborhood, we didn't have to wait. Everyone was nice and friendly and most importantly the steaks were everything they advertised. Excellent wine selection as well.
Delicious Tuna!  Wonderful wine selection. Great fun place.  Service over the top!

Love this place! As a local it is my favorite place to eat in Beverly Hills. From the bread to the John Dory fish you can't beat it. And the chocolate cake with some whipped cream or ice cream is worth dying for! The best thing about the Grill though are the people who work there. What an incredible staff! Home away from home for me!
Atmosphere was great, food very good, excellent service. Staff very friendly as well. Very nice time. Thank you!

We came for dinner and it was excellent. 
We made reservations and we were not disappointed. It was so incredibly good and we are so full! You will not be dissatisfied in the meal or service! Be sure to make a reservation because this place gets easily crowded especially on weekends!
Best waiters ever! Full of historical facts about movie stars that have dined there. Food was phenomenal.  Bella 🤩
Food was great.   Bar tender was conversational and polite
The food is good and tasty! Had the red sauce pasta with shrimp and my sister got the chicken fettuccine, they use such big plate that makes the portion so little. Dessert was good too.
Best steak in town really enjoyed atmosphere service was great should make reservations

A friend brought me here while I was in town. For someone who doesn't eat sushi much, I can say it was pretty good.

The restaurant was very crowded, as expected. We ended up sitting at the bar and making good conversation with one of the chefs. He recommended a number of dishes, so we tried them all.

Had a good time but wouldn't go out of my way to dine here again.

We recently ate here for dinner and sat at the sushi bar. 

Service was great. Food was exceptional. 

Would definitely recommend to anyone in LA to visit here!

Oh - book. We waited an hour (worth it), so make it easier on staff and book in advance.

We had a great meal here before going to a show at the theater the food is very fresh and the flavors are really nice. Staff is really friendly.  I would recommend this place and if you’re lucky chef Nobu pops in from time to time we were lucky enough to see him. He is a very gracious ,humble man .
Disgraceful meal, $170 a head for a poorly executed Omakase that lacked any refinement. We chose the $100 option and only received very little raw fish. It was all mostly cooked. Very disappointed.

This use to be one of my favorite sushi spots, however, my last visit here was very disappointing and I will not be going back. In August 2018, I was there with a group of friends celebrating my birthday. While we were eating, a roach ran past our legs. We told a server who tried to quickly pick it up and get rid of it. We tried to speak with a manager but he ignored our first two requests. At our third request, he came by and shrugged us off. Maybe this happens every other night here and it's not shocking to him, however, I expected an apology or explanation or something. He then walked off and ignored us the rest of the night. Not only were we upset by the roach and questioning the cleanliness of the restaurant and the food we just ate but we were also very unhappy in the manager's unconcerned attitude and lack of customer service.

Lovely night to spend with family and friends.  The side dishes were prepared to perfection--especially the sweet potatoes.  Biggest concern---my steak was way over cooked.  Ordered it medium rare....warm red center and it came out well done.  Not even a sign of pink.  This shouldn't happen at a top notch steak house.
Wait staff was awesome and food was superb. It’s tradition for us to find a Ruth Chris where ever we travel too. This one did not disappoint! Wonderful experience.

Totally overrated.  Ate here last night with a group of ten. Had the petite filet.  Said to the waiter that I wanted it cooked medium rare plus and then said maybe it should be medium.  He told me that it cooks very fast and I should order it medium rare.  I said okay and chose to have it cooked without butter.  I like to taste the meat.  You can put butter on feathers and it will taste great.  I guess that when they cook it and add the butter it makes the meat taste better than it really is.  So out comes our dinner and my steak is RARE and not even close to medium rare.   I ate a few bites because I was really hungry and I noticed it had a lot of pepper on it.  I finally flagged down our waiter and showed him the steak.  He agreed that it was rare and offered to bring me a hot plate, whatever good that would do, or take it back and cook it some more, which would probably dry the steak.  Since most of our party was well along in the meal, I opted to finish my steak, which by the way was not that good.  Maybe I should have had the butter.  I have had better meat from Costco prime steaks.  What a waste of money!

Consistency fantastic, the food is always delicious and the steak us done to perfection. 
We shared a large rib eye steak, medium rare, a mouth watering experience. The salads were fantastic as well- my wife enjoyed the Wedge and I loved the arugula salad.
The service is always top notch,  and our waiter Alex was attentive, friendly and made it a very pleasant evening. The martinis were great, and the cheesecake dessert with the salted caramel was devine. Obviously we will back!

Dined with family and friends and was not disappointed. The choice of steak and extensive side dishes was excellent. All our steaks were cooked as ordered and would recommend this restaurant to steak lovers visiting Waikiki. A little on the pricey side for a steak house but well worth it.

If you're on a budget don't go here. If you're looking for a California roll don't go here. If you're not a full-on foodie who likes trying something different and isn't afraid to pay for it don't go here. With that being said you got to go to here a minimum one time in your life. The presentation is amazing, if you take a sip out of your water glass somebody feels it, and let's not forget about the food! OMG the food! By the way did I mention the food?!? I can't describe it so you got to just try it:-)
best sushi in LA bar none
the chef looked like micheal jackson. it creeped me out. didnt like. 0/10
Best Japanese experience in the west coast. Worth every penny

If you love sushi and want an amazing experience that you will remember forever, this is the place to go. This really is the end all be all of any meal, period. It is the reason why I want to be rich. So that I could eat here once a month for the rest of my life. My only complaint was that I felt like it was so much amazingness packed in to one night and I wished I could break it up into four different meals and go for an hour a night for four nights so I could draw out the savoring of every melt-in-your-mouth piece. It was incredible fish and service but just so much food, and i can eat a lot. I will be back, though, for another special occasion soon. I think the bill was around $700 for 2 of us, with a bottle of sake. Every morsel of fresh fish was delightful.
